This article describes a family-focused social skills development model which has been applied in the children's mental_health field to manage children's social interaction, impulse control, and social problem-solving skills. In this model, skill training can be limited by the resources available, the challenges of the individual family situation, and whether the child is receiving inpatient or outpatient services.
